14:18 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle : hi  
14:19 <cjdelisle> ho  
14:19 <cjdelisle> err  
14:19 <cjdelisle> hi  
14:19 <pulasthi1>  cjdelisle: i went through the stuff u mentioned  
14:20 <cjdelisle> find anything interesting?  
14:20 <pulasthi1> i would say casendra plugni for DN is rather intersting  
14:20 <pulasthi1> plugin  
14:20 <cjdelisle> see my mail to the list?  
14:21 <pulasthi1> ahh ok  
14:21 <Chami1> has quit  
14:22 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <cjdelisle> So if my proposal is accepted then we'll be able to use a standardized query language (I don't have high hopes though.)  
14:23 <cjdelisle> Otherwise, we need to get on paper exactly what the requirements for success are at the beginning.  
14:26 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle: u mean if the proposal isnt accepted it will be hard to go on with gsoc project?  
14:26 <cjdelisle> Not hard. It just means that we need to get a contract telling us exactly what we have to implement before we start.  
14:27 <pulasthi1> ahh  
14:28 <cjdelisle> XWQL is "leeky" so you can sneak HQL past it. Since there is no spec ( D: ) we need someone to tell us what is needed and what we can skip.  
14:29 <pulasthi1> i almost thought that XWQL is the same as HQL  
14:30 <cjdelisle> Ofc with any luck the community will see my point that XWQL is really just a toy and if we want to be taken seriously we need to use a real query language.  
14:30 <pulasthi1> well we can right a layer to do the converstion if needed right  
14:31 <cjdelisle> Sure we can convert the broken idiom document.object(XWiki.SomeClass) into the correct format  
14:32 <pulasthi1> hmm  
14:32 <cjdelisle> However since HQL can be used in an XWQL query, being "the same" would mean rewriting hibernate which I am not doing without being paid upfront ;)  
14:33 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:34 <pulasthi1> so i want be that mach of a problem to leave it as it as  
14:34 <pulasthi1> im mean since HQL can be used  
14:35 <cjdelisle> The problem is that HQL is part of hibernate and hibernate only runs on relational databases (not cassandra and not app engine)  
14:35 <pulasthi1> btw i went though the bolg with the app engine incompatablity with JDO i also had some of those issues  
14:36 <pulasthi1> hmm  
14:36 <cjdelisle> I noticed that google seems not to be that dedicated to supporting app engine.  
14:37 <pulasthi1> ya some of the problems they seem to have just ignoerd  
14:37 <cjdelisle> What problems did you experience?  
14:37 <pulasthi1> i was lot confused at first with the presistance thing  
14:38 <rrodriguez\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <rrodriguez> has quit  
14:39 <rrodriguez\_> is now known as <rrodriguez>  
14:39 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle: so if we are to use cassendra those things want be realated  
14:39 <pulasthi1> right  
14:40 <cjdelisle> correct, we won't have to deal with google's messes if we choose casandra.  
14:41 <cjdelisle> Also I think that even though google and cassandra were the only 2 storage mediums named, we should still review other options.  
14:42 <pulasthi1> i think cassendra is the better option of those two  
14:42 <cjdelisle> If Hbase looks better then I think it is still early enough to propose a change to the project.  
14:43 <pulasthi1> ahh nver worked with Hbase  
14:44 <rrodriguez\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <pulasthi1> even if we are to use casendra the project will have to change a bit  
14:44 <rrodriguez> has quit  
14:44 <rrodriguez\_> is now known as <rrodriguez>  
14:44 <pulasthi1> the name says app engine prototype  
14:44 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:46 <pulasthi1> is Hbase batter than casensdra  
14:46 <cjdelisle> It does say cassandra in the project description, what's important to remember though is that it was written by people who didn't spend days researching the intricacies of each data store, that's out job.  
14:46 <pulasthi1> ya but the name i mean  
14:46 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:46 <cjdelisle> s/out/our/  
14:47 <pulasthi1> "s/out/our/" didnt get that  
14:47 <pulasthi1> :-/  
14:48 <cjdelisle> that s/ thing is substitution  
14:48 <cjdelisle> it's from a program called sed but people (I) use it to say replace "out" with "our" in my last message.  
14:49 <cjdelisle> Last night I researched scaling of relational databases.  
14:50 <pulasthi1> ahh  
14:50 <cjdelisle> I just started moving on to cassandra and I found that annoying bit about XWQL not being compliant.  
14:53 <pulasthi1> cjdelisle: so what whould i look into more app engine seems like a bad option  
14:53 <pulasthi1> should i look into casedra  
14:53 <pulasthi1> casendra  
14:54 <cjdelisle> You have to write a proposal, correct?  
14:54 <pulasthi1> ya  
14:55 <cjdelisle> I think it would be wize to look carefully at google bigtable benefits and costs then in your proposal explain why it is inferior to cassandra.  
14:55 <pulasthi1> ok  
14:55 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:55 <cjdelisle> I am going to compare cassandra to Hbase, an object store, and a document store.  
14:55 <pulasthi1> have u talked to the mentors about this  
14:56 <cjdelisle> About which?  
14:57 <pulasthi1> the discussions on the project  
14:57 <pulasthi1> any change should involve them right  
14:57 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:57 <cjdelisle> A lot of this information I have just learned last night, I have proposed one part on the mailing list.  
14:57 <pulasthi1> ahh kk  
14:58 <pulasthi1> ill do some reasearch today  
14:58 <pulasthi1> and hope to do the proposl tommorw  
14:58 <pulasthi1> :)  
14:58 <cjdelisle> The part about comparing the different stores, I consider that due dilligence to prove that cassandra is indeed the best option and if it is not then advise them of which one is.  
15:02 <pulasthi1> ok  
15:02 <pulasthi1> :)  
15:02 <pulasthi1> ill do my best  
15:02 <pulasthi1> thnks for ur time  
15:02 <pulasthi1> :)  
15:11 <cjdelisle> yea, about my bed time  
15:12 <pulasthi1> im sri lankan  
15:12 <pulasthi1>  cjdelisle we have our world cup finals to day  
15:12 <pulasthi1> :)  
15:13 <pulasthi1> so not that much of work today  
15:13 <pulasthi1> any way ill submit the proposal tommorw hopefully

17:21 <vmassol> mflorea: hi you there?  
17:26 <+mflorea> Hi vmassol, I'm around  
17:26 <vmassol> mflorea: just seen a git commit from you which is very strange  
17:26 <vmassol> :)  
17:26 <+mflorea> :|  
17:26 <vmassol> and it seems the history has been rewritten....  
17:26 <+mflorea> I haven't done any git commit  
17:26 <vmassol> there's a mail in notifications list  
17:27 <+mflorea> where did you saw it?  
17:27 <+mflorea> let me check  
17:27 <vmassol> today 10:38AM  
17:27 <vmassol> my changes from yesterday have been removed apparently  
17:27 <vmassol> maybe sdumitriu did something  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Ah, yes, I might have done that  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> Sorry :(  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> I resynchronized from svn  
17:28 <@sdumitriu> since I didn't push the existing branches and tags  
17:28 <vmassol> hmm ouch  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> They should be in place now  
17:29 <vmassol> would be great if you could reply to my mail  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> I'm sending a status mail in a few minutes  
17:29 <vmassol> about the git/svn plan  
17:29 <vmassol> ok  
17:29 <vmassol> since we all need to be in sync  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I'm writing it, re-reading before sending  
17:29 <vmassol> ok  
17:29 <vmassol> thanks  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> Sent  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> 1/2, going to write the second  
17:34 <vmassol> k  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> Who can help with disabling wiki/issue on github repositories?  
17:42 <vmassol> i can help  
17:43 <vmassol> it's a pain to do them one by one but I guess there's no other solution  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> Google doesn't show an alternative  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> So I guess 1by1  
17:44 <vmassol> sdumitriu: could you also explain in an email the strategy with svn externals. i see you've created gitmodules but I'm not sure why we need them and what we're going to do with thel  
17:44 <vmassol> s/thel/them/  
17:44 <vmassol> I need to read up on .gitmodules though  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> K  
17:44 <@sdumitriu> After I'll set them up and I'll test them  
17:45 <@sdumitriu> This is pretty short: http://book.git-scm.com/5\_submodules.html  
17:46 <@sdumitriu> Seems easy to checkout, but the commits are a bit more complicated since they require a confirmed synchronization of the parent  
17:46 <@sdumitriu> Like:  
17:46 <@sdumitriu> - commit in submodule  
17:46 <@sdumitriu> - mark in the parent that the new version of the submodule is the one you want  
17:47 <@sdumitriu> This is because a submodule is not a link to another repository, but a link to a specific version of another repository  
17:47 <shweta> has quit  
17:48 <@sdumitriu> So when you checkout trunks-3.0 you can checkout the submodules at the right tag as well  
17:56 <vmassol> sdumitriu: it's possible to script it :) see http://develop.github.com/p/repo.html  
17:56 <vmassol> "Set Repo Info"  
17:56 <@sdumitriu> Cool  
18:19 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: WDYT of the mail? Does it answer your questions?  
18:20 <vmassol> started answering but I'm a bit busy with other oss guys....

22:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Where should I put xwiki-tools? Under platform or in the top-level trunks?  
22:51 <vmassol> ideally I'd keep the same structure as now since otherwise you loose the relationship of xwiki-tools with platofmr  
22:51 <vmassol> there are also tools but in commons  
22:51 <@sdumitriu> K, so in platform  
22:52 <vmassol> I think we shouldn't change anything as we're currently doing without discussing them first on the list  
22:52 <vmassol> since they have important implications  
22:52 <@sdumitriu> We did discuss  
22:52 <@sdumitriu> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/k6hb7v63igrbtxiy#query:+page:1+mid:k6hb7v63igrbtxiy+state:results  
22:52 <vmassol> yes this needs to be a bit revisited with teh introduciton of comomns  
22:53 <vmassol> (commons & rendering to be precise)  
22:53 <vmassol> I haven't thought about it  
22:53 <vmassol> so I don't know what's best right now  
22:54 <@sdumitriu> K, I'll put it under platform and we'll see later  
22:54 <vmassol> k  
22:54 <@sdumitriu> Trying a clean checkout to see how it goes
